page.title: 03Scotton & Northorpe: Housing
page.content: Most families live in owner occupied property, rented houses being almost entirely council built. In Scotton more than half the 25 council houses, including 12 bungalows for the elderly in Dooks Close, are rented: out of Northorpe's 13 council houses 4 have recently been bought by their occupiers. In each village there is still one 'tied' house attached to a farm. There are no estates, local planning policy allows infilling only: there is little room left for building Of the 150 houses in Scotton less than 40 are more than 60 years old: Northorpe has a higher proportion of older houses. House prices are among the lowest in the country: a modern 4 bedroomed house in Scotton, with central heating and a large garden is priced at Â£41,000 compared with Â£27,000 for a similar house in 1978.
